intro: Scilla villosa, commonly known as the woolly scilla, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped blue or violet flowers in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Scilla villosa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
